titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ohio State University, Office of Research, Vice President for Research Records, 1954-1975 RG.7.A
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Karen Glenn

publicationstmt.publisher: Ohio State University Libraries Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-05-09T11:22-0400

did.unittitle: Ohio State University, Office of Research, Vice President for Research Records

repository.corpname: Ohio State University Libraries Special Collections

did.abstract: In 1962, Ohio State University transferred research responsibilities from the Vice President for Instruction and Research and delegated them to the Vice President for Research. This position became the executive head of the Office of Research and President of the Research Foundation. The position ceased to exist on January 1, 1970. The Ohio State University, Office of Research, Vice President for Research Records contain grant proposals, correspondence, project reports, and other administrative records related to the Higher Education Facilities Act of 1963, the Ohio State University Research Foundation, and research activities in various colleges and departments on campus. The collection dates from 1954-1975.
did.physdesc: (11) cartons, (1) 5" letter document box, (1) 2.5" letter document box

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Ohio State University. Office of Research.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of Materials
arrangement.p:
Materials are arranged in 5 series:
Series 1: General File
Series 2: Ohio State University Research Foundation
Series 3: Research Activity
Series 4: Federal Programs
Series 5: Grant Applications

acqinfo.head: Acquisitions Information
acqinfo.p: Accession Number UA.1971.0042: Office of Academic Affairs, date unknown; Accession Number UA.1972.0056: Graduate School, date unknown

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

accessrestrict.head: Access to Materials
accessrestrict.p: Materials in this collection are available for patron research, but may be used only in the University Archives Reading Room.

userestrict.head: Use of Materials
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be protected by copyright, and are made available for research and educational purposes. In general, the OSU Libraries do not own the copyright for materials from our collections and cannot grant copyright permissions for these materials. The user is responsible for making a final determination of copyright status. If copyright protection applies, permission must be obtained from the copyright holder to reuse, publish, or reproduce the work beyond the bounds of fair use or other exceptions to the law. Works in the public domain are not protected by copyright and do not require permission to use.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Finding aid written by: Karen Glenn, 2018 May

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: In 1962, Ohio State University transferred research responsibilities from the Vice President for Instruction and Research and delegated them to the Vice President for Research. This position became the executive head of the Office of Research, and was filled by the chairman of the Department of Chemistry, Alfred B. Garrett. Garrett also filled the role of Research Foundation President. The position ceased to exist on January 1, 1970, when Dr. Garrett resigned to return to teaching chemistry. Responsibilities for research were then combined with the Office of Academic Affairs, and a Vice President for Research and Sponsored Programs was appointed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ohio State University, Office of Research, Vice President for Research Records contain grant proposals, correspondence, project reports, and other administrative records related to the Higher Education Facilities Act of 1963 and other federal programs, the Ohio State University Research Foundation, and research activities in various colleges and departments on campus. The collection dates from 1954-1975.
